001package io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.selenium.smart;
002
003import io.cyborgcode.roa.ui.annotations.HandleUiException;
004import java.lang.reflect.Method;
005import java.util.HashSet;
006import java.util.Set;
007import org.openqa.selenium.support.ui.FluentWait;
008
009/**
010 * Utility class for inspecting stack traces to determine if an exception
011 * originated from a {@link SmartWebElement} or {@link SmartWebDriver} method.
012 *
013 * <p>It checks if the method was annotated with {@link HandleUiException},
014 * if it originated from a wait operation, and if the exception was handled.
015 *
016 * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
017 */
018public final class SmartWebElementInspector {
019
020   private static final String SMART_WEB_ELEMENT_CLASS = SmartWebElement.class.getName();
021   private static final String SMART_WEB_DRIVER_CLASS = SmartWebDriver.class.getName();
022   private static final Set<String> ANNOTATED_METHODS = new HashSet<>();
023
024   static {
025      for (Method m : SmartWebElement.class.getDeclaredMethods()) {
026         if (m.isAnnotationPresent(HandleUiException.class)) {
027            ANNOTATED_METHODS.add(m.getName());
028         }
029      }
030   }
031
032   /**
033    * Private constructor to prevent instantiation.
034    */
035   private SmartWebElementInspector() {
036   }
037
038   /**
039    * Inspects the stack trace of a given {@link Throwable} to determine if it originated from
040    * a method annotated with {@link HandleUiException}, if it involved the `handleException` method,
041    * or if it occurred during a Selenium {@link FluentWait} operation.
042    *
043    * @param t The throwable to inspect.
044    * @return A {@link Result} object containing flags indicating the exception's origin.
045    */
046   public static Result inspectStackTrace(Throwable t) {
047      if (t == null) {
048         return new Result(false, false, false);
049      }
050
051      boolean foundAnnotatedMethod = false;
052      boolean foundHandleException = false;
053      boolean comingFromWait = false;
054
055      for (StackTraceElement element : t.getStackTrace()) {
056         String className = element.getClassName();
057         String methodName = element.getMethodName();
058
059         if (isFromWait(className)) {
060            comingFromWait = true;
061         }
062
063         if (isSmartComponent(className)) {
064            if (isAnnotated(methodName)) {
065               foundAnnotatedMethod = true;
066            }
067            if (isHandleException(methodName)) {
068               foundHandleException = true;
069            }
070         }
071      }
072
073      return new Result(foundAnnotatedMethod, foundHandleException, comingFromWait);
074   }
075
076   private static boolean isFromWait(String className) {
077      return FluentWait.class.getName().equals(className);
078   }
079
080   private static boolean isSmartComponent(String className) {
081      return SMART_WEB_ELEMENT_CLASS.equals(className) || SMART_WEB_DRIVER_CLASS.equals(className);
082   }
083
084   private static boolean isAnnotated(String methodName) {
085      return ANNOTATED_METHODS.contains(methodName);
086   }
087
088   private static boolean isHandleException(String methodName) {
089      return "handleException".equals(methodName);
090   }
091
092   /**
093    * Represents the result of a stack trace inspection, indicating whether an exception
094    * was caused by an annotated method, was handled, or originated from a wait operation.
095    *
096    * @author Cyborg Code Syndicate üíçüë®üíª
097    */
098   public record Result(boolean foundAnnotatedMethod, boolean foundHandleException, boolean comingFromWait) {
099
100   }
101}
